author: MoreUnits4You
body:
**PoTD Record: 13-3, +8.61u**

Last Pick: FK Buducnost Podgorica ML vs Mornar @ -110 ✅

**Today’s Pick: Phoenix Rising FC ML vs Las Vegas Lights FC @ -190**

(25 hours from this post)

Hey All - Back at it today with the daily football/soccer play. The FK Buducnost play @ -110 was a hit and we seemingly jumped on an error by the sportsbooks if you managed to get in early enough as it peaked around -270. Based on the outpouring of private messages it seems like a lot of people took that winner so thrilled to hear that. 

With that being said, we’re going to tackle another lesser known league - USL Championship (USA). This is the second division of football here in the US and has a ton of smaller market teams that play in some fairly fun games. It’s worth noting I’m betting this on FanDuel here in the US. Knowing that there are a lot of international redditors here as well as redditors from all over the US, this may actually be obscure enough that it is not able to be bet where you are. Apologies if that’s the case - we’re going back to European Top 5 Leagues tomorrow!

With respect to the game, there’s really two angles here. First and, perhaps less importantly, the Las Vegas Lights are last in the Western Division of the USL with a record of 0-6-4 through 10 games. In 8 of their 10 games this season, they’ve only scored 1 goal or less but have managed to snag a ton of draws which shows some of their defensive formidability. Phoenix Rising is in the upper half of the table in the Western Conference (4-4-2, 16pts through 10 games) and following an uncharacteristic season last year they typically are a dominant team in the USL (Fun fact: this team became popular when Didier Drogba became a big investor and played for them for two seasons a few years ago).

The second angle to this bet is that it’s $1 Beer Night. Stick with me here as this isn’t a joke. Phoenix Rising FC is 16-0-0 in their $1 Beer Night promotion. This promotion became a huge deal several years ago where they were essentially unbeatable on this night haha. During the last several seasons (USL did not play in 2020), $1 Beer Night was not a promotion that was done and it was brought back this year for the home opener - another game they won. 

So with all the being said, it should be a raucous night in Phoenix on Friday night. The home support should be plentiful (and electric I would have to assume). Couple this with the fact that the opposition has not won a game all year and we have ourselves a Play of The Day.

As I said, apologies if this game is not available to everyone and apologies for picking a game 25 hours away! For those that do tail, bet responsibly and lock in quickly. With it already being at -190 this line is bound to rise to a point where it’s unplayable. See you all tomorrow. 

**1 Unit Play**

Best of Luck!
